theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutations, ROS production, oxidative damage, and impaired oxidative phosphorylation as drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mtDNA mutations, oxidative phosphorylation decline, and their causal role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA mutations, increased ROS, and ATP decline to aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative stress, ROS damage, and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative damage accumulation, mtDNA deletions, and respiratory chain dysfunction in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutations, respiratory chain defects, ROS production, and aging causality.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced mtDNA damage, respiratory decline, and aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial oxidative damage, enzyme dysfunction, and antioxidant interventions delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS and Oxidative Phosphorylation Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial respiratory chain dysfunction, ROS vicious cycle, and permeability transition pore in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on inherited mtDNA haplogroups, somatic mtDNA mutations, heteroplasmy, and mitochondrial-nuclear cross-talk affecting aging and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutations driving aging, threshold effects, and systemic mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA point mutations causing respiratory chain deficiency and premature aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA mutation accumulation to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging phenotypes; highlights mitochondrial biogenesis as compensatory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA copy number decline, integrity loss, and their causal role in vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes coordination of mitochondrial biogenesis and mitophagy maintaining mitochondrial homeostasis and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial fusion/fission dynamics regulating mitochondrial fitness and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy decline with aging impairing mitochondrial quality control and promoting cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction including impaired biogenesis, turnover, and mitophagy contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial quality control failure, dynamics decline, mitophagy impairment, and mtDNA mutation accumulation in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial chaperone Hsp22 maintaining OXPHOS and mitochondrial homeostasis to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Biogenesis and Metabolic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on PGC-1α regulation of mitochondrial biogenesis, metabolism, and brain aging via growth signaling pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Biogenesis and Metabolic Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial-encoded peptide MOTS-c regulating metabolism, physical capacity, and aging via bi-genomic signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Overload and Excitotoxicity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial calcium overload causing excitotoxic apoptosis in aging neurons and neuroprotection by modulating mitochondrial Ca2+ uptake.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Overload and Excitotoxicity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial respiratory chain failure causing energy deficiency and cellular attrition, linked to excitotoxic neuronal loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Calcium Overload and Excitotoxicity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial damage accumulation, ROS production, lysosomal dysfunction, and impaired degradation contributing to aging.
